title: Lawsuit Filed for Migrant Detainee Access to Lawyers
description: Legal aid organizations sued the Trump administration, seeking access to lawyers for migrants detained at Guantánamo Bay to challenge their detention. The lawsuit also included relatives of three detainees who had lost contact with them.

profile.text:
The Lawsuit Filed for Migrant Detainee Access to Lawyers was initiated on Wednesday^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461] by a group of legal aid organizations against the Trump administration^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The lawsuit seeks to grant migrants detained at Guantánamo Bay access to legal counsel to challenge their detention^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

Lee Gelernt, an American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) immigrant rights lawyer, is the lead counsel in the lawsuit^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The plaintiffs include relatives of three detainees at the base who claim to have lost contact with the men and are concerned about their well-being^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. Two of the migrants named in the suit are Luis Alberto Castillo Rivera and Tilso Ramon Gomez Lugo, who are among the 53 being held in Camp 6^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

The lawsuit argues that the government is violating the rights of the detainees by holding them at Guantánamo Bay, effectively creating a 'legal black hole' where they are denied access to counsel^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The suit emphasizes that immigrant detainees within the United States have the right to access counsel, a right that the government cannot circumvent by detaining them on an island in Cuba^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The legal basis for the Trump administration's decision to hold individuals arrested in the U.S. at Guantánamo for immigration detention purposes is unclear^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

title: Venezuelan Migrants Transferred to Guantánamo Bay
description: The Trump administration sent dozens of Venezuelan migrants to Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, where they are being guarded by troops rather than civilian immigration officers. The migrants are being held in Camp 6, a prison building where al-Qaida suspects were previously held.

profile.text:
The Trump administration transferred dozens of Venezuelan migrants from detention in Texas to the U.S. military base in Guantánamo Bay, Cuba^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. As of Tuesday, ICE had sent a total of 98 men to Guantánamo^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The U.S. Southern Command has been streaming staff and support personnel to the base since Trump's order on January 29^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

*   The migrants are reportedly being guarded by troops rather than civilian immigration officers^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].
*   53 of the migrants were being held in Camp 6, a prison building previously used for al-Qaida suspects^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].
*   The other 45 migrants were being held in a lower-security building and guarded by the Coast Guard^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].
*   The criterion for transfer was Venezuelans in ICE custody, who have been difficult to deport due to strained diplomatic relations^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

The Trump administration has described some of the migrants as gang members, but has not offered evidence^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The administration claims each migrant had a final deportation order and committed a crime by entering the U.S. illegally^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

The transfers have raised legal questions, particularly regarding the authority to detain individuals arrested in the U.S. at Guantánamo^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) and other legal aid organizations have filed a lawsuit seeking access to lawyers for the migrants^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. Lee Gelernt of the ACLU is the lead counsel in the lawsuit^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The lawsuit includes relatives of detainees who have lost contact with them^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. Two of the migrants named in the suit are Luis Alberto Castillo Rivera and Tilso Ramon Gomez Lugo^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards
